page.title: 20EMPLOYMENT
page.content: The falling school rolls in Shirebrook have resulted in the amalgamation of a junior and infant in 1984. Because the emptied school was so close to the centre of Shirebrook and of such useful dimensions it was converted into a community centre and a youth training workshop. On visiting the workshop we found that up to 50 unemployed teenagers are being given a year's training in one of the following subjects - Sewing, Furniture repairs, Upholstery, Joinery and Metalwork. Most of the students find a permanent job at the end of the course. There are 10 full-time professional instuctor. J.SINGLETON, J.DYSON, S.COULTON.
